body_html:
@sherrym First thank you for helping on this.
I'm a little bit confused. By removing the input map do you mean I change that line to just tf.import_graph_def(g.as_graph_def()) ?

But in here http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34343259/is-there-an-example-on-how-to-generate-protobuf-files-holding-trained-tensorflow/34343517#34343517 in step 4 @mrry says "use the input_map argument to replace each variable in g_1 with the corresponding tf.constant() tensors created in step 3. "

How do they get assigned to the variables in graph without an input map argument?

body:
@sherrym First thank you for helping on this. 
I'm a little bit confused. By removing the input map do you mean I change that line to just `tf.import_graph_def(g.as_graph_def())` ?

But in here  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34343259/is-there-an-example-on-how-to-generate-protobuf-files-holding-trained-tensorflow/34343517#34343517 in step 4 @mrry says "use the input_map argument to replace each variable in g_1 with the corresponding tf.constant() tensors created in step 3. " 

How do they get assigned to the variables in graph without an input map argument?
